alert.note: Alert for Sussex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 8:45AM EST until January 13 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Virginia... Nottoway River Near Stony Creek affecting Sussex County. For the Chowan Basin...including Rawlings, Stony Creek, Sebrell, Lawrenceville, Emporia, Franklin...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Nottoway River near Stony Creek. * WHEN...From this morning to Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Jarratt boat ramp, approximately 5 miles upstream, has water completely covering the concrete boat launch area. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 14.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning to a crest of 16.6 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.6 feet on 04/02/2001. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 845 PM EST.
